QAPair.Question: What is (are) Asthma - what to ask your doctor - child ?
QAPair.Answer: Asthma is a problem with the airways that bring oxygen to your lungs. A child with asthma may not feel symptoms all the time. But when an asthma attack happens, it becomes hard for air to pass through the airways. The symptoms are: Coughing, Wheezing, Chest tightness, Shortness of breath , Below are some questions you may want to ask your health care provider to help you take care of your child's asthma.
